body:
<!--
**PLEASE READ THIS FIRST:**
- DO NOT use the bug and feature tracker for general questions and support requests.
  Use the `cython-users` mailing list instead.
  It has a wider audience, so you get more and better answers.
- Did you search for similar issues already?
  Please do, it helps to save us precious time that we otherwise could not invest into development.
- Did you try the latest master branch or pre-release?
  It might already have what you want to report.
  Also see the [Changelog](https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/CHANGES.rst) regarding recent changes.
-->

Hello up there. I've hit Python abort on a code that uses both memoryview slices and exception raised from inside closure. Please see below for details:


```cython
def f(s):
    g(s)

cdef g(const unsigned char[::1]s):
    cdef int i = 0
    cdef int l = len(s)
    def nextchar():
        nonlocal i
        if i >= l:
            raise ValueError("END")
        c = s[i]
        i += 1
        return c

    while 1:
        c = nextchar()
        print(c)

f(b'123')
```

```console
(neo) (py3.venv) (g.env) kirr@deca:~/tmp/trashme$ cythonize -i x.pyx && python -c 'import x'
Compiling /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/x.pyx because it changed.
[1/1] Cythonizing /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/x.pyx
/home/kirr/src/wendelin/venv/py3.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/Main.py:369: FutureWarning: Cython directive 'language_level' not set, using 2 for now (Py2). This will change in a later release! File: /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/x.pyx
  tree = Parsing.p_module(s, pxd, full_module_name)
running build_ext
building 'x' extension
creating /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/tmpapksgq8t/home
creating /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/tmpapksgq8t/home/kirr
creating /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/tmpapksgq8t/home/kirr/tmp
creating /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/tmpapksgq8t/home/kirr/tmp/trashme
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -pthread -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -g -ffile-prefix-map=/build/python3.9-RNBry6/python3.9-3.9.2=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -g -fwrapv -O2 -g -ffile-prefix-map=/build/python3.9-RNBry6/python3.9-3.9.2=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -fPIC -I/home/kirr/src/wendelin/venv/py3.venv/include -I/usr/include/python3.9 -c /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/x.c -o /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/tmpapksgq8t/home/kirr/tmp/trashme/x.o
x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -pthread -shared -Wl,-O1 -Wl,-Bsymbolic-functions -Wl,-z,relro -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wl,-z,relro -g -fwrapv -O2 -g -ffile-prefix-map=/build/python3.9-RNBry6/python3.9-3.9.2=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/tmpapksgq8t/home/kirr/tmp/trashme/x.o -o /home/kirr/tmp/trashme/x.cpython-39-x86_64-linux-gnu.so

49
50
51
Fatal Python error: __pyx_fatalerror: Acquisition count is 0 (line 2297)
Python runtime state: initialized
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "x.pyx", line 16, in x.g
    c = nextchar()
  File "x.pyx", line 10, in x.g.nextchar
    raise ValueError("END")
ValueError: END
Аварийный останов

```

**Expected behavior**
ValueError('END') raised but no `Fatal Python error: __pyx_fatalerror: Acquisition count is 0 (line 2297)`

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Debian GNU/Linux 11
 - Python version 3.9.2
 - Cython version 0.29.30

**Additional context**

https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4662 might be related.

Thanks beforehand,
Kirill

comment_data.body: It's also broken on the current master version.

FWIW the exception also doesn't make any difference. The memoryview isn't incremented when it's captured, but it's decremented when it's released, so it crashes whenever `nextchar` is cleaned up. I'm actually amazed that this has gone unreported for so long.
Not sure this should be closed? https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/4848 will fix it properly on master
I wasn't sure either. I closed it because it's no longer an issue in the latest 0.29.x branch. But you're right, it's probably better to mark this as only (really) fixed in 3.0.
@da-woods, thanks for e4ef0c1e807aab8c20fb08b638550c912c166be3. And it is good to see https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/4848 is also there for Cython 3.0.

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: [BUG] __pyx_fatalerror: Acquisition count is 0  (with memoryview slices, closures and exceptions)
